text: Bottle. Hazy golden colour with stable white head off. Aroma of tropical fruits, hoppy. Taste of peach, passionfruits, hoppy finish. Medium carbonation, solid body. Long bitter aftertaste
bottle. Cloudy golden with a tall head. Malty, lots of fruity hops that add hints of apricot and peach.

Bottle. Pours foggy honey yellow. Big dendse white head. Good retention. The aroma is hoppy. Peach, passion fruit, tangerine, a hint of earth. Light to medium body. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Dry flavour. Tart fruity and earthy hops rule it. Wheat malts in the background. Light to medium bitterness. High class wheat ale.

Bu en cours de zythologie .
Bouteille de 33cl
Verre de 15cl.
Belle couleur bien dorÃ©e trÃ¨s pure brillance et reflet jaune.
Mousse prÃ©sente mais redescend rapidement. 
Au nez : houblon type agrumes fruit de la passion .
En bouche : note intense de de fruit de la passion , agrumes intense pamplemousse et citrus. 
Belle amertume progressive et docile. 
Belle arriÃ¨re et belle longueur.

Hazy and straw coloured. Hoppy aroma with citrus, orange and spice. Dryish and somewhat pungent taste, followed by a solid, spicy hop flavour. Finishes quite bitter. Medium body, and a smooth mouthfeel. Overall, a pretty decent wheat IPA. Not as good as Blossom, which has a better balance. This one is too dry.

Bottle 33 cl from Brus. Pours light hazy yellow with a strong white head. Really nice aroma with coriander, citrus and plum. Rather weak and watery taste. Was hoping for a stronger taste. Medium bitterness. Notes of melon and citrus.
Burk. Dimmig ljusorange med ett vitt skum. Dofter av blomster, citrus, persika och vete. Smakinslag av apelsin, citron, persika, blomster, vete och tall. Fruktig och lÃ¤tt besk avslutning.

Aroma; lemon candies, corianderish grapefruit, pale fresh malt notes with roasted corners
Look; off white head, clear deep golden body.
Taste; hops, lemon, coriander, fruity malt, sweet notes - fine balanced finish. 
Feel; semi dry, fresh n fruity.
Overall; good brew.
[33cl.btl abv6% @Agenturet TromsÃ¸]

To Ã–lÂ’s take on the old American wheat ale style and one that apparently made it into the top-50 in its category here, physically made in Belgium; curious to see what this Danish gypsy brewery made of a very American Â’craftÂ’ style pioneered by AnchorÂ’s Summer Wheat in 1984. Medium thick, regularly shaped, off-white, moussy head leaving behind an intricate pattern of Â’paperÂ’ lacing and in the middle, falling apart into an equally intricate Â’Brugse kantÂ’-like, flat island; lightly hazy, Â’old goldÂ’ robe with warm orangey tinge, with a Â’fogÂ’ of yeast bits everywhere, turning equally misty and deeper orange-ish with sediment. Fragrant and rather Â’dankÂ’ aroma of lime flesh, lightly toasted white bread, fresh dill, butter on the brink of turning rancid but not quite, cream cheese, ripe starfruit, lemon zest, apricot, soap, tulips, cooked pumpkin flesh, very creamy potato mash, very vague hints of banana, minerals, iron, cloves and fresh spinach leaves. Fruity onset but restrainedly so, hints of unripe peach, some raw pineapple, vague banana (but not descending into overt bubblegum effects at all) and pear, sweetish with mildly sourish surroundings, crisp carbonation but not exagerrated for this particular style and adding minerally effects, supple mouthfeel. Softly grainy middle, pale malt sweetishness Â’thickenedÂ’ by a dimly sourish and subduedly soapy wheatiness which takes over in the end but in all remains clean and slender as it should be in this specific wheat beer style, increasing amount of retronasal phenols towards the end but only adding mild spiciness; aromatic hoppiness dominates the finish, very APA-like, with a clear, pleasantly drying yet gentle bitterness, while at the same time releasing quite a lot of retronasal lime juice and Â’oldÂ’ grapefruit aromas. Ends notably yeasty - though not too Â’starchÂ’-like, but the wheat slickness gets the last word, adorned by an ethereal New World hop presence both in aroma and in bitterness; light but unmistakable minerals support this hop character even more (than necessary, IÂ’d almost add). I remember more classic examples of American wheat being more Â’wheatyÂ’ and less hoppy: this is more an APA with wheat than a Â’classicÂ’ American wheat ale to me, but since it does use wheat and this component is noticeable all the way through, I guess it qualifies and meets the requirements of the style. Hoppier than I expected, but in a good way; in all, a lovely beer for sure, I could drink this all day in summer, but beers like this are doubtlessly better fresh from tap so I hope to encounter it in that condition one day.

Cloudy golden honey color, floaters, thick tan head. Fruity nose, melon, mandarin orange, peach. Citrus taste with lemon, orange and grapefruit, spicy notes, grass, moderate bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation, oily texture.

33 cl, bottle conditioned, BB Sep 20th 2018. Hazy, golden amber, thin head, low carbonation, loads of sediment chunks. Aroma is piny and hoppy, some tropical notes. Mouhfeel is fizzy and dry, well carbonated. Taste is hoppy and sharp, very nice biscuity and bready malt backbone. Nice tasting beer, but all those big floating sediments is quite unpleasant for me personally.

On tap at Brewdog bar Tallinn. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow colour. Thin white head. Fruity, slightly flowery aroma. Fruity, bit flowery taste. Citrussy and flowery finish. Light bodied, medium carbonated, nice and well drinkable wheat beer.
Hazy golden colour. Aroma is lots of mango and lemon. Taste is well-hopped with a tart finish. Creamy texture.

33cl can, at home. Just visually itÂ’s an experience on itÂ’s own. Not only the label design is one of the most beautiful IÂ’ve seen, but the beer itself looks incredibly nice too. 2 inch white head over a hazy but vivid amber orange body. ItÂ’s a lot more hoppy than your average wheat ale, and it almost feels entirely like an american pale ale. Aroma is citrus, mango and honey. While the taste is nice there is nothing particularly outstanding about it, but it feels great both in texture and finish. If this was a random brewery with a mediocre label design IÂ’d probably rate it much lower, but IÂ’m biased towards To Ã˜l.
Herbal en nariz. Buen cuerpo, algo de cereal, lupulada y de amargor agradable. Muy buena. Batch 1243 BB 20/09/2017

Hazy golden, white head. Aroma is full of hoppy citrus, lime, lemon zest. It resembles a pale ale. Taste follows the nose, with some lemongrass. A bit harsh on the tongue, but it will quench your thirst. Dry finish. Good.

Rami Rami is drinking a Hibernate by To Ã˜l at BrewDog Warszawa

Nieintensywne, lakowe, troche ciastkowe, troche brzoskwiniowe, slodkawe lekko... nudnawe. Niemniej przyjemne
Dorado, aroma dulce, narnajas. Sabor amargo pero equilibrado. Textura muy cremosa, probablemente por el trigo.

Canned. Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and flowers. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A nice hoppy Wheat. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
Keg at The Pint Shop, Oxford. Clouded pale gold with white head. There is a herbal, flowery, clove like spiced note to this, banana and pear drop. It was somewhat over the top for me unfortunately.

Tap, shared by Marduk, thanks! Clear golden yellow, small white head. Nose is slightly sour and fruity, citrus, oranges, malts. Flavor is herbal and citric, orange peel. Mild and fruity finish, medium hoppy bitterness. Decent.

Tap. Hazy golden color. Medium size, beige head, stays. Fruity, sweet, citrus, oranges in aroma. Malty, caramel, fruity, oranges in taste. Very fruity and citrusy in aftertaste. Short crisp carbonation. Drinkable brew.

Tap (Pudel, Tallinn)
Hazy light orange, small tight head. Lacing looks like river polution! Nice orangey aroma. Lightish, even wateryish palate, crisply carbonation, quite refreshing, not saying itÂ’s a 6% brew at all. Some light wheatiness in the taste, a hint of orange zest again. Finish gently bitter. Kind of bland, but refreshingly gluggable,and the alcoholÂ’s nowhere to be seen.
hazy deep golden color with a white head. taste is malt, wheat, citrus, orange. nice

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy deep golden with dense white head. Aroma of oranges, mandarins, peaches, some pine needles. Tastes bitter with some sweetness. Dry mouth feel, almost tart. Medium to thin bodied.

Tap at pudel. Pours amber. Aroma is hoppy, fruity, citrus. Flavor is sweet and bitter, citrus, tangerines, caramel, burnt sugar, pine. Finish is sweet and dry-pine bitter. Overall: ok, bit too sweet, clearly more ipa than wheat beer.
How: bottle Appearance: hazy amber, medium white head. Aroma: spice, citrus, grass, some yeast. Palate: light body, average carbonaiton-.
0.33l bottle. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma: citrus, mango, juicy, yeast. Taste: citrus, resinous, spicy. Light to medium body. Higher bitterness with long duration. Dry finish.

From backlog. Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, wheat, mango, earthy notes and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, wheat, mango, earthy notes and grass. Good wheat ale.

This is how an American Wheat Ale should taste.....but itÂ’s brewed in Belgium. They really do it right over there. Has a medium to dark yellow-goldish appearance. Great balance with decent amount of hops to take the edge off the wheat. Has near-IPA characteristics in both flavor and feel. Actually more like a hoppy/wheaty pale ale. Brother-in-law brought this and an IPA from De Proef over from Denmark. Thanks bro!

Bottle 33cl, a cloudy copper beer with low head. Nose is on exotic fruits, peach, red fruit touch. Aroma is on the same fruit notes, touch of wheat, light cereal, still fresh fruit notes with notes of grapefruit. Correct but very common.
Disig gyllengul Ã¶l med ett finbubbligt stÃ¶rre vitt skum. Doft av hÃ¶, grÃ¤s, sÃ¶ta kex och viss Ã¶rtighet. I smaken tillkommer citrus.

Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma has some slightly dank hops with fruity notes. Taste starts with citrus fruits and grassy hops, medium bitterness from start to finish. Medium to light bodied, medium to light carbonation. Overall itÂ’s a quite nice, easy drinking hoppy ale.

330ml can from Hippo Beers. Cloudy amber brown, massive foamy head, lot of sediment, nice artwork. Wheaty clove aroma. Dry wheat flavour. Bitter lemon aftertaste. Big flavour and a good example of this style of beer but it doesnÂ’t really do it for me.
Can from mchughs. Pours cloudy gold. Spice, yeast citrus peel,funk.Flavour is a effervescent highly carbonated dry spice peel. Dry finish. Nice.
Tap @ BD Turku. Clear copper. Apricot, mango and banana. Wheat with fruit, although not exactly any of the abovementioned. Medium body with oily palate. Somewhat stuffy for a wheat beer.
Hazy orange, thick white head. Hoppy grapefruit aroma. Grassy, citrus peel, hop, some resinous aftertaste, crisp but complex. Very, very nice.

Crisp fruit aroma and taste with a medley of citrus and tropical fruits, wheat, light malty, slight grassy and floral hoppy finish.

Orange copper hazy body, medium white head lasting.
Papaya, mango, tropical fruites
Bottle at home. Pours golden orange, nose is herbal, musty toffee, taste is sweet, creamy, funky.
@ Stordirren 16-12-7: Trevlig doft av vete och citrus. LÃ¤tt och vÃ¤lbalanserad i smaken.

BiÃ¨re intÃ©ressante. Attaque fruitÃ©e. AgrÃ©able. Amertume modÃ©rÃ©e. 
JÂ’ai apprÃ©ciÃ© cette dÃ©gustation

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, orange, tropical fruit, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, wheat, orange and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Amazing appearance and a great palate; together with a good aroma and taste.

Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazy light brown pour with a big frothy off white head, aroma has some decent tropical hop action along with light clove and minerals, taste has spice, some peach, pineapple, grassy yeast profile.
Puszka. Niezbyt intensywny ale przyjemny aromat chmielowo pszeniczny. Smak lekko gorzki, wytrawny, w smaku cytrusy.

Can from Hops and Crafts Exeter. Pours hazy orange with a massive off white head. Aroma perfumed hop,violets , mango & passion fruit & fresh bread. Taste is citrus hop,bread with hop bitterness. Light bodied & welll carbonated the finish is dry,bitter with more delicious citrus hop flavours. Decent!

33cl bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam on 22-Apr-2016. Hazy orange colour with a medium sized off-white head. Aroma of bitter tangerine, yeast and spices. Medium body and carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel. Bitter tangy fruit flavour and medium caramel sweetness. A lovely well balanced beer.

F: huge, white, creamy, good retention.
C: golden to orange, hazy, opaque.
A: floral, citrus, lemon, orange, caramel, yeasty, dusty, light banana, mango.
T: BB: 11/12/2015, malty, caramel, grapefruit, lemon, earthy bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, pine resin, medium to medium full body, good carbonation, 0,33l bottle from De Bierkoning in Amsterdam, very good beer well balanced citrus sweet with quite good hoppy bitterness.
Bottle from Metro Wines, Syston, Leics. Excellent wheat beer. Sweet, chalky mouthfeel. Lots of Meltis fruit hops. Mint leaf candy sugar. Sweet, tangy. Really, really good.

Miam !
Le nez est magnifiquement fruitÃ© : des fruits tropicaux (mangue, papaye), des fruits rouges (fraises, framboises). On sent un fond cÃ©rÃ©alier, maltÃ© mÃªme.
La bouche est trÃ¨s sÃ¨che, attaque ronde bien "blanche", finale trÃ¨s fruitÃ©e, fond peu amer. Longueur houblonnÃ©e sur les tropicaux.
Pas Ã©normÃ©ment de corps mais reste intÃ©ressante.

Pours cloudy, yellow colour with a decent head. Complex aroma of white wine, red apple, a trace of peach, flowers and - on top of that - spices. Pretty the same notes in the taste with apples and spices (ginger or so) slightly pronounced, the bitterness is noticeable yet not exaggerated. I could even sense a whiff of bretts in the aftertaste... they should be here or not doesnÂ’t matter at all. Exceptionally good session beer.
Very nice Danish Wheat Ale. Has a nice thick texture and a great and full aroma.
Botten @ Dansken. Cloudy golden with a medium white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Fruit, flowers, spice and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter / fruity finish.
Bottle. Golden pour. Mild aroma of citrus, wheat and orange. Taste of bitter orange zest, citrus, creamy wheat and some caramel. Good stuff.

Flaske 330ml spandert av Rune. Delt pÃ¥ Nerstranda 27 Okt 15. Lys gyldenbrun. HÃ¸yt skinnende hvitt skum. Pen lacing. Forsiktig fruktaroma. Fersken. Smaken ogsÃ¥ behersket. Litt syrlig frukt med en tÃ¸rr avslutning.

330ml bottle picked up at Vinmonopolet Vika in Oslo a while ago. One-finger thick, white tophead. Clear honey coloured body. Spotty lacing. Moderate malt-fruity aroma, herbal hops and brown malts. Rounded taste profile of wheat, leafy hops, spices, and mild yeasty esters. Bittersweet endnotes. Fine bodied. Refreshing and tasty (shared with Finn, TromsÃ¸ 27.10.2015).

ap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours golden yellow with a slice of white head. Aroma presents with a fresh sweetness, a dash of citrus, some lime, hay and grass. Also some more earthy and fruity stuff. Taste is mild and definitely on the sweeter side with some toasted fudge, lots of malty sweetness, sugar and a generally smooth mouthfeel with a slight stickyness. A bit of bitterness in the back, but nothing much. Refreshing yet still nicely potent.


Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours clear golden with a medium white head. Aromas of wheat, citrus, banana, malt, lime, hay, earthy notes. Taste is mild, sweet, toasted notes, malt, hoppy, grass, banana, citrus.
I know I had a bottle of this, but I donÂ’t remember much other than the nice wheat flavour subtlely blended with the spices. Yum!

Bottled 330ml. -from Za PopenÂ’t Ljubljana. Darker golden coloured, medium sized white head, citrusy nose. Slightly yeasty, very citrusy hoppy, fruity and spicy with pleasant hop bitterness in the finish and aftertaste. You canÂ’t miss with this one. Really nice.

Bottle
Aroma-fruits
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall- very good
Excellent fresh hop aroma. Yeast and wheat taste with some honey notes. Classical IPA hoppy/bitter end.

Creamy head. Aroma of blossoms, tropical fruit and yeast. Taste is wheat, brett, yeast, citrus and grassy. Spring in a glass. Great beer. Beautiful palate. To me, beauty lies in simplicity. Synesthesia flashes: green, pink and yellow.

good nose and palete.
Flavour lets it down.
Wheaty yeasty, leaning more towards an IPA than anything else...

Bottle from Junkyard, Nottingham.

Pours cloudy yellow, single finger white head. Aroma of clove, citrus, light herb and touch of banana. Taste of light malts to start then a herby smoothness, light hops and more herbs. Very nice.

Aroma is clove, straw, and citrus. Taste is a light crisp maltiness that finishes smoothly with a medium hop body that has slight clove and tanin notes but finished smoothly overall. Appearance is a clear gold with a medium fluffy head that retains very well.

Botella de 33 cl en el coleccionista de gijon el 08-04-2015. Cons pref para antes de 11-12-2015. color rubio con espuma blanca aromas y sabores maltosos y cereales con toques frescos de lÃºpulos. cuerpo medio con 6 vol fÃ¡cil de beber.No esta mal, refrescante.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma wheat spicy fruits citrus some pineapple and bitter hops flavor wheat spicy citrus pineapple and bitter hops

330 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy amber with moderate head. Aromas of grain, coriander, citrus and wet malts. Flavors of biscuit dough, wheat, light orange, and wine gums. And maybe some creamy brett effects. Very nice
Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Fruity aroma, mango, malts, hops. Fruity, light sweet flavour, wheat. Fruity finish. Nice. (from 33cL bottle @ RoelÂ’s Bonzai tasting, Oirschot)
Bottle @benzai. Orange color with a small white head. Smells and tastes sweet, malty, grassy, hoppy.
Bottle @ benzai. Clear golden colour with a small to medium sized white head. Smells hops, fresh, nice. Tastes hops, fresh, sweet, nice. Medium body, nice carbo.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Dutchdrebus. Clear golden color, average sized white head. Smell and taste wheat, decently fruity, lightly yeasty, a hint of sweetness, a hint of hops. Decent body and carbonation.
330ml bottle. Hazy orange with a fluffy white head in the glass. Hoppy aroma of citrus and caramel. Sweet and fresh taste. Sugar, lemon, wheat, wine gums. Beautiful dry aftertaste. Very good!

Bottle brought to my hands by his royal slickness , Monsieur Scheffel. Pours hazy dark golden with a frothy white head. Flowers, wheat, crackers, citrus and strawberries. Dry and crisp. Very good quaffer and overly superb made Wheat Ale.
UPDATED: MAR 19, 2015 Hazy, golden beer with frothy white head. Tastes of wheat, slight funk, malt, creamy, citrus. Really superb beer. Very drinkable, slightly sweet and bitter finish. Lovely.

Big frothy head misty deep gold pour medium carbonation aromas floral grain yeast spice lemon lime mild ginger flavours marmalade taste ginger wheat citrus a bitter note not that inspiring on the palate the finish tasted better watery ale wheat ales really not that good these days this in that mode
Bottle from Cottridge Wines. Hazy Amber colour, with a foamy white head. Aroma has fruit, wheat, malts anf citrus. Slightly bitter flavour. Very nice.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 Aroma of light malt, citrus, bread, spicy yeast, floral notes, hint of funk, fresh hops. Flavour is light sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Light and easily drinkable, a nice brew.

33 cl. bottle. Hazy, golden colour with an amber tint. Big, fluffy white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, spices, lemon, wheat malts, floral hops and light yeasts. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Rather filling for a wheat beer. Finishes dry and bitter with a good dose of spices and citrus fruits. Very nice winter wheat beer.

Bottle at home. Hazy orange pour, thin white head. Aroma is quite fruity, some wheat, spicy malts, some lemon peel and a bit yeasty. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity and a bit dry. Slightly off balance, but well drinkable.

330 ml. bottle @ home from Caigny. BBF 11/12/2015. Light bright orange, creamy, thick white head. Very fruity citrus hops nose, light floral edge to them, lemon drops, pear. Taste is pear, apple, super creamy wheat, very subtle flavor, light cider, lemon drops, lychee, very faint floral tang at the end, lots of pear, faint candy. Super fruity. Super juicy. Extremely delicious. This is why I love To Ã˜l. This is just the kind of beer I absolutely adore for sub-9 % ABV beers, super easy to drink & ridiculously fruity. Not too much bitterness, not to heavy body. Nuanced, so much fruit. This is highly delicious.
Light body, wheat and apricot. Slightly astringent. Not so interesting, but decent.
Bottle from The Vineyard. Slightly hazy gold, decent fluffy white head. Citrusy notes in the aroma and flavour, light, refreshing body, quite fizzy, short finish. Pleasant.

Bottle from PeckhamÂ’s. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Average carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of orange, lemon and white bread. Flavour of orange, lime and light spice. Thin body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. Nice but not particularly complex.
330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Small beige head. Cloudy orange/yellow body. Aroma is mostly grapefruit, pine and caramel. Slightly bitter on the tongue with a light sweetness.

clear yellow, smooth offwhite head.
bitter exotic fruity and bitter malty aroma. lots of bitter ripe fruit peely notes. flavor is malts, bitter fruity hops, relatively simple hoppy flavor. Does not really fit into the wheat ale RB description as i see it.

Bottle. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Moderate yeasty mango notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Nice yeasty and hoppy notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Bottle. Beermoth, Manchester. Hazy gold. Thick, dense, lasting, off white head. Lemon hop. Soft toffee. Sweet grain. Very light spice. Soft, saison funk. Taste is light sweet. Turns light dry. A little oily bitterness, too. Light, airy, creamy palate. Finishes with a funky, chewy, sweet and light sourness. Very tasty. Silly drinkable.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2014 Bottle from Mane Liquor. A summer quaffer if IÂ’ve ever had one! Very floral and lemon driven with mild sourness which drives the beer. ItÂ’s bordering on a Berliner Weisse I think. Sessionable sour with a nice mild hoppiness to it. Kind of reminds me of a toned down, more quaffable Wheat is the New Hops. Bloody good

Bottle. Very hazy medium golden body with a fluffy white head that laces nicely. Pine and a bit of white grapefruit hop aroma. Less aromatic hop character on the palate, grassy and a bit coniferous I guess, but the bitterness is harsh and intense. A very hoppy wheat-based brew that is lacking in brightness (but to be fair, this bottle is of unknown age).
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Hellbraun trÃ¼b, leichtem schaum, schÃ¶ne Kombination aus WeiÃŸbier und Hopfen in der Nase, getrocknete FrÃ¼chte, nette MalzsÃ¼sse im Antrunk, SchÃ¶ne, fruchtige bittere im Abgang

Bottle, 0.33l. Cloudy deep golden color with medium creamy off-white head and soft visible carbonation. Aroma of wheat, pungent grapefruit, mango, spices and yeast. Taste starts with light sweet, but rich toasted malt, follows by refreshing grainy and fruity sourness, spicy, crisp and dry mouthfeel, while finish is moderate bitter. Medium to full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. My first one of that style, grainy and hoppy, that suits me well..

Bottle shared at Groove Beer e Grill, Matera. Pours very hazy orange amber with an off white head. Aroma of dough, biscuity malt, light citrus banana, and weeds. Flavor is light to light moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with light to moderate carbonation.

Bottle at GrÃ¼nerlÃ¸kka Brygghus, march 25th 2014. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, bread, yeast. Taste is mild hoppy fruits, pale malt, a light sweetness, with a strong fruity finish. Nice and refreshing.

Fermentoren, Aarhus, DK.
Tap, 0714.
Light amber with White head. Aroma of citrus and spices. Flavor with wheat and some fruit

Bottle at home. High creamy and lasting white head. Cloudy yellow body. Sweet fruity straw bisquit aroma. Bitter sweet sour apples dusty malt straw flavor with a sensible amount of hops bitterness, grassy notes, low carbonation and short finish.
Hazy golden colour, small white head. Creamy mouthfeel. Pear and orange on the nose, slightly tart taste, with a hint of cucumber. Not bad, not amazing.

Bottle 33 cl.
Clear orange, white head. Fresh hoppy citrus aroma. Crisp sweet, lightly spiced, citrus taste. With dry bitter finish. Absolutely enjoyable.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy golden coloured with floral and citrus fruity flavours, orange blossom and lemon notes with vanilla on the spicy, zesty finish.
Gulbrun klar med kremete hÃ¸yt beige skum. Lukter ananas og humle. Humlebitter med fin sitrus i bakgrunnen. Medium kullsyre, medium fyldig. Kort bitter avslutning.
Blond, light fruity, floral hops but quite mild still. Well developed, not quite as interesting as I hoped. (33cl bottle from BiÃ¨re RÃ©volution shared with Guus and Tim)

BOTTLE 33CL from ivodoni1. Na zdrave!

Look: hazy amber, off-white, biggish frothy head with good retention.
Aroma: tat fruity and spicy hops, minty, some spicy yeast notes too.
Taste: tart and astringent fruitiness, spicy bitter finish. Nice creamy body.

330ml bottle pours a hazy golden color with a 2 finger white head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is citrus with some cereal grains and light fruits. Taste is a grapefruit and spicy hop bitterness with a light caramel and grainy malt sweetness. Medium bodied with nice carbonation which prickles the tongue. A nicely done brew for the style. Recommended..

Draught @ Fermentoren, Ã…rhus. Pours dark yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, caramel, sugar, sweet fruit, peach. Flavor is wheat, caramel, little coconut, fruit. Thin body, soft carbonation. 120714
Tap. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, spice, fruit and hops.

Bottle,6%. Hazy dark yellow with big white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, wheat, hop and citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, wheat, hop, grapefruit, little sweet, notes of phenols, spices, little dry and medium bitter.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours golden yellow with a slice of white head. Aroma presents with a fresh sweetness, a dash of citrus, some lime, hay and grass. Also some more earthy and fruity stuff. Taste is mild and definitely on the sweeter side with some toasted fudge, lots of malty sweetness, sugar and a generally smooth mouthfeel with a slight stickyness. A bit of bitterness in the back, but nothing much. Refreshing yet still nicely potent.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2014 Alla spina. Nebuloso color dorato con soffice schiuma bianca. Sentori fruttati di albicocca, pane e luppolo; gusto amarognolo e secco con note erbacee e leggermente fruttate. Corpo lieve, effervescenza gentile, struttura setosa.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a finger thick airy head. Aroma is hoppy and quite tropical with peach and mango. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter with grapefruit and orange peel, as well as hoppy peach and lychee.

Bottle from Magasin du Nord, Denmark. Pours unclear brown-yellow with a huge fluffy head that first recedes with huge bubbles. Dry, notes of pine, citrus, bitter fruits, quite bitter for the style. Slightly sweeter aftertaste.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are hops, fruits, flowers, malt, elderflowers and has e anice fresh fruity finish. Easy drinkable.

Bottle. It pours an unclear, orange colored body under a small, off-white head. The aroma is fruity and citrusy, lots of orange going on, leaving the malts in the back. ItÂ’s full to medium bodied, with a pleasant carbonation level. Quite dry on the palate, with flavors of pale malts in the back, and citrusy, piney hops up front. A nice bitterness too, although a tad zesty. Lasting orangey, bitter finish. Not a beer IÂ’d choose if I were to hibernate, IÂ’d go for something full, darker and stronger then, but in the summer heat I could easily down a few. 140529

Bottle 330ml @ Cabin, TrÃ¥sÃ¥vika Camping
Pours slightly hazy deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, citrus, hint of chalk and orange. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long citrus/orange fruity and bitter finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at RJ. Pours golden color, nice very stable creamy head. Aroma is very citrusy, orange, tangerines, grapefruit, hoppy. Taste is bitter, medium sweet, tangerines, orange, grapefruit, some hints of wheat, hops, weak soap note at the finish.

Tap at RJ. Aroma citrus, orange peel, tangerine, very fresh. Hazy golden colour, stable head. Taste is intensely hoppy, but has just the right amount of balancing sweetness of malt. Tangerine is first impression, then resiny. Very nice, tasty. Easy drinking, alcohol hidden well, though the finish is lightly warm.

Tapped at Hostinec Richtar Jakub in Bratislava/Slovakia. Overall an excellent aromatic and tasty beer! Sweet banana aroma, leeches, bublegum, some spices. Beautiful orange golden color, thick creamy head. Taste is banana, bitter hops, bitter fruits. Very refreshing. Pleasant mild hoppy finish with again banana, leeches, a lot of fruits. Damn tasty!

Handbottled from Richtar Jakub. Orange amber color with medium off-white head. Aroma of fruity hops with oranges, tangerines, mango, lychee, grapefruit zest. Solid malty backbone with wheat followed by nice portion of fruity hops with mango, tangerines, oranges, grapefruit zest, grapefruit, pines.Nice long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.
33cl bottle at cerveteca Lisboa. Clear gold color. Head is thin. Medium body. Medium bitterness. Aroma is passion fruit, banana and hops.
Birra dal gusto allo stesso tempo intenso e delicato. Note luppolate e citriche si intrecciano con sentori maltati, sfumature di buccia dÂ’arancia e frutta, buon amaro. Buona!
UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Draught sample at Mikkeller and Friends (Stefansgade). Pours orange hazy, aroma of hops and wheat, flavor of wheat, slightly funky, medium bodied.

duft: citrus. mango. en blid duft af humle.
smag: lime. bÃ¦r. sÃ¸dme. jodbÃ¦r eftersmag. god god tÃ¸rst slukker.
Nose is peach acidity, almond, limoncello, corn, later green peas, feel is medium, taste is bile, leaves, some bitter lemon, weak soap note

Bottle 330ml. [ As To Ã˜l Hibernate ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average to large, creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, spicy, lemon, orange - citrus. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a long duration, lime, zest, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140212]

[5/3/14] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Hazy amber. Hoppy aroma, citric and piney. Flavor has some sweetness, some fruitiness, a bit of yeast, citric hops and mild to moderate bitterness. Medium-bodied.

Bottle at the Euston Tap, London on 2 May. Poured a hazy golden colour, with a large white head. Aroma of citrus hop, wheat and straw. Grapefruit hoppy flavours with some grass and cereal. Finish was pine needles, dried fruit and some yeast esters.

Bottle from Kihoskh. Clear golden with a big off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, wheaty and moderate hoppy - citrus and flowers. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 050514

quite dense ivorywhite head disappears with structured lacing. orange yellow colour. aroma passionfruit, grapefruit, sweet, peach, hoppy. taste like aroma with a very nice bitter balance. quite dense mouthfeel, medium carbonation.  bottle 33 cl / bbf dec-2015

Clear, pure golden. Medium, shiny white head. Hay and grass-scented hops to the nose. Some dry pale malts too, without being particulary wheaty. Clean on the palate, light to medium body. Taste is dry and fruity, well hopped, yet with a fine underlying malt-sweetness. Dry, herbal malt-accented finish. Pretty good stuff. [0,33 l bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika]

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a slightly hazy amber body with a large foamy off-white head. Nose is nutty wheat tones, red fruits, sweet red berries, hay and hints of pale malts, grass and herbs. Taste is sweet grainy wheat tones, peaches, red berries, pale malts, grass and hints of red fruits and hay. Full body, medium to high carbonation. Not bad, but not very remarkable either.
330ml bottle. Pours gold with a medium frothy head. Aroma is wheaty with orange squash and coriander. Taste is creamy to start. Spicy coriander finish with some lemon.
Shared bottle at Cardinal. Clear golden body with a small white head leaving excellent lacing. Grassy, sprucy light funky nose. Funky, fruity flavors. Medium body. Pleasant finish.
Almost clear golden. Dense off-white head. Fruity grape fruit, but perhaps also something unfresh, in aroma. Similarly citrusy taste.

Flaska frÃ¥n Mikkeller&Friends. Orange, disig medelhÃ¶gt vitt skum. Maltig doft med karamell och fruktig humle med aprikos, persika och mandarin. Frisk, lÃ¤tt syrlig fast rejÃ¤l karamellig maltkropp, stram och torr avslutning med citrus. Fin citrusskalstorr eftersmak. En bra Vete-IPA, varken mer eller mindre.
Hazy golden colour with lasting head. Aroma has tropical fruits but also a touch of banana and pale malt. Flavour is fruity and slightly tart leading to a clean but bitter finish.

DAA; My first wheat ale. What a nice style. Pours orange golden with a lasting frothy, creamy, leaving loads of lacings white to off-white head. Nose is malt, yeasty, light sweet fruity, light tropic fruity adding citrus whispers. Taste is moderate sweet and bitter with spice, all lasting and satisfactory. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

14th April 2014Euston Tap. Keg. Mini bimble with Ian Harrison. Hazy gold beer, small pale cream coloured head. Palate is airy and crisp, fine carbonation. Light malts, little lactose sweetness. Mild tinned tropical fruits. Light floralness before a light finish. Comes together well. Easy drinking.
On tap at Euston Tap. Bit dull boring cold toffeee. Not great. not much hop. Bit unimpressed
Drank at Ã–rebro Ã–lcafÃ©. Fresh smell, fruity, hoppy and bready. Light hoppy taste, fruity and bready. Fresh and easy to drink, I also wrote down "American wheat beer?".

Bottle @ DeleteBeach - day 1. Pours hazy orange with a moderate and lasting white head. Aroma is hoppy with citrus,papaya, cereal, hay, spruce and tangerine. Taste is light+ sweet and bitter, very light acidic. Body is light, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes balanced and hoppy. Very drinkable and delicious.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Light copper, big beige head. Smells of citrus, malts, dust, some spices; totally quite weak on the aroma. Moderate sweet, some citrus and fruity notes, some dusty flavors as well, easy drinkable. Moderate bitter, some smooth fruity things in the back. When i drank this i didnÂ’t think of wheat a single time!
Mikkeller and friends feb 1. Den har en fin balans men Ã¤r nÃ¥got ljus i fÃ¤rgen.
On tap at OÂ’Connors. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma fruity, earth and flowers. Taste is light and fresh, earth, wheat with a flowery finish. Nice!
Che meravigliaaaaaaaaaaaaa, datemene un fusto. Splendida, naso fantastico, fruttato delicato, uno dei piÃ¹ buoni che abbia mai sentito. In bocca poi Ã¨ perfetta.
Pours hazy yellow with a medium sized frothy white head. Delicious hoppy nose.

Aroma: tropical fruits, peaches. Appearance: cloudy pale gold, medium frothy head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: fruit explosion and yet bitters coming up quickly, average to long-dry finish. Overall: very nice Wheat Ale, aroma and palate. Pint at Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.

On tap at Mikkeller Stockholm. 

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, hay, bread and something that reminded of "tutti-frutti". Soft and easy to drink.

Dobre pachnace cala skrzynka swiezotkich rozowych grejfrutow, Sweetie oraz pomelo jednoczesnie. Pszeniczna nutka oraz tresciwy smak. Gozkawe. Slodowosc srednia ale posmak chmieli z USA powala. Jakby to bylo imperial IPA. skorka pomaranczy jakby tu takze obecna byla w dubeltowej ilosci. Bardzo dobre Wheat Ale

Appearance: Hazy golden color, with a fine thick white head. Good lacing.Aroma: Grapefruit hoppy, malty, wheat and fruity.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet, and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Balanced grapefruit hoppy, pleasant tropical fruity, wheat and an ok malty back.Overall impression: Wheat aleÂ….well they can call it whatever they want. Lovely hop juice.Personal stats: Bottle from Vinonopolet Vika in Oslo, Norway

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Golden hazy color, good foam. Immediate hoppy aromas, some fruitiness and citrus and nice yeast influence. Medium body & complexity . Solid bitterness. Very enjoyable

330 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 6%. Hazy golden colour, moderate white head. Spicy and yeasty aroma and flavour, also strong notes of citrus and hops. Maybe a bit too far out on the yeasty side, but still very drinkable.

Draught @ Biercab, Barcelona

Pours orange with a smooth white head. Aroma of wheaty malts, earthy notes, floral hops, biscuity notes and grass. Taste is smooth, biscuity and wheaty with some floral hoppiness and grassy notes. Finish is sweetish, juicy and floral with some biscuity notes. Okay hoppy wheat ale.

Good white head, fed by medium to good carbonation in veiled copper-orange beer. Very fruity nose; peach, nectarine, exotic fruit. Also something milky. Milk, creamy again in the mouth. Flavour of not-quite-ripe wild strawberries (litte scarlets). Moderate bitterness as background, some dry malts, wheat. Long bitterish aftertaste, reveiling a certain oxydation, and a reminisence of Brettanomyces. Medium bodied, quite (wheat)slick. Not bad.
Lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Mild lukt av lys malt og sitrus. Smak av lys malt og sitrus. Fruktig. Vinmonopolet.

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph. Pours hazy dark yellow with a medium, creamy white head. Good duration. Aroma has apricot, peach, lemon, green apple peel. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has soft sweet wheat, light grainy, citrus and apple zest. Good lingering, fresh hoppy bitterness. Them boys donÂ’t do much wrong.

Bottle. Pours light hazed golden with a very big creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, some flowery hops, grass and resins. Taste is bitter, fruity and herbal hops, some resins, light sweet grainy malts. Slick & light sticky mouthfeel. Lingering dry fruity bitter, nice.

04.03.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, leafs, dried fruits, light malts, hay, citrus, hops, yeast. Taste is slightly dry grassy, leafs, hops, hay, citrus peel, grass, sap, light malts, hints of pine needles. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly oily mouthfeel. Nice.

Very cloudy, golden colored with a creamy looking white head. Mellow aroma with citrus, light malts and grass. Taste is light sweet at first, but finishes on a decent bitter note. Light malts and citrus again dominating. A nice, refreshing, and highly drinkable beer.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2014 Bottle @home. Pours golden with a white foam. Smells like peach, fresh and fruity aroma. Taste has hints of peach, medium bitterness. Bitter finish. Actually pretty nice.

Pours hazy amber with a finger of white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, light honey and pine. Taste is a mix of hops and honey, with fairly dominant honey in the finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

Draught at The Rover, GÃ¶teborg. Hazy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Malty biscuit flavor, caramel, grassy, nuts, hay, bready, floral notes. Hoppy citrus flavor, Sheraton, cream, caramel, hazelnuts, floral, citrus, earthy notes. Well balanced beer.

Pours a cloudy apricot with a medium compact white head. Aroma is grapefruit, peach, resin, hay. Taste is grapefruit, peach, gooseberry, honey, some slight herbal notes. Quite good.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends 8/2-2014. Ganska sÃ¶t och fruktig, humlig, citrus. Torr och humlig avslutning.
Overall: Orange, lemon, spicy. Nice.Note: Bottle 330 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-02-15.

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy pale orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Bottle. Fucking beautiful label with all kinds of colours and shit. Pours hazy yellow with a medium sized frothy white head. Delicious hoppy nose. Light bodied with lots of tropical fruity hops, light straw, hay, crackers. Oily texture, medium carbonation, little sweetness and bitterness. Lingering hops in the finish. Very light and drinkable.

Bottled. A yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of fruits, hops, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, malt, fruits, hops, lemongrass, cinnamon, and other spices, leading to a dry finish.

Bottle at home.
Hazy amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of pine needles and hops with notes of citrus.
Sweet and fruity flavour of hops and citrus with notes of spices and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
Bottle at home shared with T&M. Pale, hazy golden with a small white head. Dry and hoppy with aromas of Belgian yeast. Medium to light bodied. Soft carbonation. Dry finish.
Bottle at SuneÂ’s Place. Cloudy yellow - white head. Nice fruity hoppy. Acid notes from wheat. Nice super fresh hoppy. Tropical fruits. Light estery - light yeasty.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a huge white head. Aroma is mild yeasty, citrusy hoppy. Smooth mouthfeel. Crisp fruity, light citrusy and mild appleish. Smooth, mellow fruity into a mild finish.
